seo.title: A Complete Guide to Image Optimization

whyMatters.title: Why Image Optimization Matters
whyMatters.content: In today's digital landscape, image optimization is crucial for website performance, user experience, and SEO rankings. Large, unoptimized images can significantly slow down your website, leading to higher bounce rates and lower conversion rates. Studies show that a one-second delay in page load time can result in a 7% reduction in conversions.

formats.title: Understanding Image Formats
formats.content: Different image formats serve different purposes. JPEG is ideal for photographs with complex colors, PNG excels at graphics with transparency, WebP offers superior compression for both photos and graphics, and AVIF represents the cutting edge with even better compression ratios. Choosing the right format can reduce file sizes by up to 50% without visible quality loss.

processing.title: Client-Side vs Server-Side Processing
processing.content: Traditional image compression tools require uploading your files to a server, which raises privacy concerns and adds latency. Client-side processing, powered by modern browser technologies like WebAssembly, keeps your data secure while delivering comparable or better performance. This approach is particularly important for sensitive images or when working with large batches of files.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Web Images
bestPractices.content: To achieve optimal results, always compress images before uploading them to your website. Use responsive images with multiple sizes for different screen resolutions. Implement lazy loading to defer off-screen images. Consider using modern formats like WebP and AVIF with fallbacks for older browsers. These practices combined can reduce your page weight by 60-80% while maintaining visual quality.

imageProcessing.formatAutoHint: Smart choice based on your image
imageProcessing.fileSizeIncreasedTip: Try lowering quality (40-60%) or switching to a different format for better compression.

about.title: About CompressImage
about.intro: We believe that image optimization should be fast, secure, and accessible to everyone.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: CompressImage was created to solve a simple problem that many of us, as developers and creators, face every day: how to quickly compress images without sacrificing quality or our privacy. We were tired of slow, ad-filled tools that required uploading our sensitive files to third-party servers. We knew there had to be a better way. Our mission is to provide a tool that we ourselves love to use—one that processes everything locally in your browser, ensuring your images never leave your device.

whyUs.title: Why Choose Us
whyUs.content: Unlike other compression tools that treat your data as a commodity, we believe your privacy is a right, not a feature. This belief is at the core of everything we do. All processing happens directly in your browser using advanced, client-side algorithms built on WebAssembly. This means faster processing, complete privacy, and no frustrating file size limits imposed by a server. It's just you, your browser, and a powerful tool working together.

technology.title: Our Technology
technology.content: We are passionate about leveraging modern web technologies to deliver the best possible results. Our tool supports multiple image formats, including next-gen formats like AVIF and WebP, for superior compression. We provide fine-grained control over compression settings and a real-time visual comparison slider, giving you the perfect balance between file size and quality.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.content: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you. We are a small team dedicated to building the best image optimization tool possible, and your voice helps shape our future. Visit our <contactLink>Contact Page</contactLink> or reach out through our support channels.

feedback.title: Provide Feedback
feedback.description: Have a suggestion? We'd love to hear it.

compression.question: How does the compression work?
compression.answer: All compression happens locally in your browser using advanced algorithms. Your images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy.

formats.question: What image formats are supported?
formats.answer: We support all major image formats, including JPG, PNG, WebP, and the next-generation AVIF format. You can also convert between formats while optimizing.

fileSize.question: Is there a file size limit?
fileSize.answer: No! Since all processing happens in your browser, there are no artificial file size limits. However, please note that very large files (e.g., over 30MB) may take longer to process depending on your computer's performance.

batch.question: Can I compress multiple images at once?
batch.answer: Yes, you can upload and process multiple images simultaneously on our free plan. For advanced batch processing features and higher throughput, consider our upcoming Pro plan.

quality.question: Will compression reduce image quality?
quality.answer: You have full control over the compression level via the quality slider. Higher compression reduces the file size but may affect quality. We recommend using our live visual comparison slider to find the ideal balance for your needs.

free.question: Is CompressImage really free?
free.answer: Yes, the core features of CompressImage are completely free for everyone. We have generous limits for everyday use. In the future, we will introduce an optional Pro plan for users with heavy-duty professional needs.

browsers.question: Which browsers are supported?
browsers.answer: CompressImage uses modern browser technologies like WebAssembly. For the best performance, we recommend using the latest version of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari, or Microsoft Edge.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy is the most important feature of CompressImage. This policy is written in plain language to be as clear as possible about how we handle your data.

images.title: The Most Important Thing: Your Images
images.paragraph1: We never see, upload, store, or transmit your images. Period.
images.paragraph2: All image processing happens exclusively within your web browser on your own computer (this is known as "client-side processing"). Your files are never sent over the network to our servers or any third-party service.

collect.title: What Information We Collect
collect.intro: To improve our service and understand how our website is used, we collect a minimal amount of anonymous, non-personal data.

analytics.title: Anonymous Usage Analytics
analytics.description: We use a privacy-focused analytics tool (like Plausible or Fathom) to count things like page visits and session duration. This data is aggregated and cannot be used to identify you personally.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.description: If you choose to contact us via email, we will use your email address solely to respond to your inquiry.

notCollect.title: What Information We DO NOT Collect
notCollect.intro: Our commitment to your privacy is just as much about what we don't do.
notCollect.item1: We do not collect any personal information or metadata (like EXIF data) from your images.
notCollect.item2: We do not use Google Analytics or any tool that creates invasive user profiles.
notCollect.item3: We do not use cookies for tracking or advertising purposes.
notCollect.item4: We do not sell or share your information with any third parties.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: We use only essential (or "strictly necessary") cookies to ensure the website functions properly, for example, to remember your preferred theme (light/dark mode). These cookies do not track you and are not used for advertising.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.description: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the "Effective Date" at the top.

contactSection.title: Contact Us
contactSection.description: If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please do not hesitate to contact us at:

useOfService.title: 1. Use of Service
useOfService.content: Welcome to CompressImage! By accessing or using our website and services ("Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, revocable license to use our Service for your personal and commercial projects, subject to these terms.

userResponsibilities.title: 2. User Responsibilities
userResponsibilities.content: You are solely responsible for the content of the images you process through our Service. You agree not to use the Service to process any content that is illegal, harmful, or violates the rights of others. As all processing is done locally on your device, we have no access to or control over your content.

disclaimer.title: 3. Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimer.content: The Service is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis without any warranties, express or implied. We do not warrant that the service will meet your requirements or be available on an uninterrupted, secure, or error-free basis.

limitation.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
limitation.content: In no event shall CompressImage, its creators, or affiliates be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including without limitation, loss of profits, data, goodwill, or other intangible losses, resulting from your access to or use of or inability to access or use the Service.

changes.title: 5. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will provide notice of any significant changes by updating the date at the top of this page. Your continued use of the Service after such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new terms.

law.title: 6. Governing Law
law.content: These Terms shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Oregon, United States, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

contactSection.title: 7. Contact Us
contactSection.content: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at
